awd_titl_txt: Conference: Genetic Recombination and Genome Rearrangments FASEB Summer Research Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
This award is for support of the conference Genetic Recombination and Genome Rearrangements, to be held August 14-19, 2022 in Steamboat Springs, Colorado.  This is a well-established conference that has occurred biennially since 1985. The meeting will include 8 plenary sessions, each of which will have 6 to 8 20 minute presentations. Two thirds of the speakers are by invitation, and the remainder will be from contributed abstracts, with an emphasis on early career scientists. This meeting will have over 200 participants representing all career stages, from trainees to established PI’s. The committee will make a special effort to provide plenary speaking opportunities and short poster talks to diverse junior scientists as well. Notably, all NSF funds will be used to support participation by trainees and young investigators, with an emphasis on those from under-represented groups as well as those with financial need. 

The conference will focus on the topic of recombination and its implications for chromosome segregation, DNA repair, genome rearrangement, and mutation. These topics will be explored from multiple perspectives,including structural and biophysical analyses of the proteins involved in recombination, and genomic analyses of the consequences of recombination for genome structure. The meeting will emphasize breakthroughs spurred by cutting-edge approaches from structural biology, molecular genetics, and biochemistry as applied to DNA damage responses, chromatin remodeling, and the general processes of replication and recombination.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology (FASEB) is a non-profit federation of scientific societies encompassing life sciences research. FASEB sponsors conferences that enable scientists working in specific areas of research to gather for intensive, interactive meetings to present their latest discoveries and explore new research directions. These conferences are supported by attendee fees as well as grants and sponsorship from industry, private foundations, and the federal government. In 2022, a FASEB conference on was held to promote interaction among scientists working in the areas of Genetic Recombination and Genome Rearrangements.

Genetic recombination is a chromosome repair process that is essential to maintain genome integrity in all organisms. During cellular growth, genetic recombination repairs damage to DNA. Defective recombination can cause mutations that cause cancer and other diseases. Recombination is also essential for fertility and errors in this process cause birth defects. Substantial progress has been made in understanding recombination, but much remains to be learned regarding the underlying molecular mechanisms and their regulation, and the biological consequences of this fundamental biological process. The conference was devoted to promoting progress in these areas.

This conference brought together 124 scientists from North America, Europe, and Asia. More than sixty principal investigators and postdoctoral fellows presented talks about their teams’ latest discoveries. All other attendees, including graduate students, postdoctoral fellows, and junior faculty, gave poster presentations or short talks. A major emphasis of this conference was junior researchers at early stages in their scientific careers. Funding provided by a conference grant from the National Science Foundation provided support for several young scientists to attend this conference, present their research, and forge networks and collaborations.
